title: 111_hr4937
content: The Act titled "SSI Savers Act of 2010" increases resource limits and includes inflation adjustment. The SSI Savers Act of 2010 raises resource limits and includes an inflation adjustment. The resource limits are increased to $7,500 on January 1, 2011, and to $5,000 on the same date. The SSI Savers Act of 2010 raises resource limits and includes an inflation adjustment. Dollar amounts are increased by a percentage and rounded to the closest multiple of $100 based on the unrounded amount for the prior 12-month period. Limited exclusion from resources of certain deferred compensation and education savings arrangements. Section 1613 of the Social Security Act is amended to include the value of assets in various financial accounts for individuals not covered under a specific section of the Act. The value of retirement plans, accounts, annuities, and trusts excluded from tax is determined by the Commissioner, with limits based on age and marital status. For individuals under 65, the value of funds in a qualified tuition program is also considered. The Internal Revenue Code allows for tax-exempt retirement plans, accounts, annuities, and trusts, with limits set by the Commissioner based on age and marital status. Additionally, qualified tuition programs and individual development accounts may also be considered for tax benefits. Adjustments for inflation are made to dollar amounts periodically. The Internal Revenue Code sets limits for tax-exempt retirement plans, accounts, annuities, and trusts based on age and marital status. Dollar amounts are adjusted for inflation periodically, with increases rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. SEC. 4. Imputation of Income From Certain Deferred Compensation Arrangements under the Social Security Act. Imputation of income from assets exceeding specified amounts for eligible individuals over 65 years old under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act increases dollar amounts under section 1611(a) by a percentage in section 1617, with adjustments based on the prior 12-month period. One-third of assets distributed to eligible individuals over 65 are excluded under section 1612(b). The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the requirement for SSI recipients to apply for periodic payments from certain deferred compensation arrangements. The effective date for these amendments applies to benefits for calendar months after the enactment of the Act.
